bib.title: Knowledge acquisition from social platforms based on network distributions fitting
bib.author: Jankowski, Jaros{\l}aw and Michalski, Rados{\l}aw and Br{\'o}dka, Piotr and Kazienko, Przemys{\l}aw and Utz, Sonja
bib.abstract: The uniqueness of online social networks makes it possible to implement new methods that increase the quality and effectiveness of research processes. While surveys are one of the most important tools for research, the representativeness of selected online samples is often a challenge and the results are hardly generalizable. An approach based on surveys with representativeness targeted at network measure distributions is proposed and analyzed in this paper. Its main goal is to focus not only on sample representativeness in terms of
